Uses of Class
graph.GraphException

  • Packages that use GraphException 
    Package Description
    graph
    graph package: a collection of classes for representing graphs, hyper-graphs and algorithms operating on such discrete finite structures.
    graph.coarsening
    package defines abstract classes and implements algorithms for coarsening graphs.
    utils
    utils package: containing useful classes and methods including I/O manipulation.

    • Uses of GraphException in graph

      Methods in graph that throw GraphException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void HGraph.addHLink(java.util.Set nodeids, double weight) 
      void Graph.addLink(int starta, int enda, double weight)
      add a (directed) link between nodes with id starta and enda.
      java.util.Set Graph.getAllConnectedBy1Nodes(java.lang.Integer maxcount)
      return the Set of all sets of nodeids with the property that they are independent (maximal) and at distance at most 2 from each other within the set they are in.
      java.util.Set Graph.getAllConnectedLinks(int k)
      computes *all* maximal subsets of arcs in this Graph with the property that any two arcs in a set s that is returned are at a distance one from each other.
      java.util.Set Graph.getAllConnectedNodes(int k)
      return a Set > that is the set of all sets of nodeids in the result set that have the property that are maximal sets of nodes that are connected with each other with at most 1 hop.
      double Graph.getCliqueLabelSupport(java.util.Set nodes, Graph g)
      get the support of a clique of this node in the other Graph g, in terms of their labels.
      Graph Graph.getDual()
      construct and return the dual of this graph.
      Graph[] Graph.getGraphComponents()
      return all maximal components of this Graph as an array of new Graph objects.
      int HGraph.getHNodeIdByLabel(java.lang.Object label) 
      java.util.Set Graph.getNborIds(java.util.Set nodeids)
      return all node ids of the nodes that are immediate neighbors of any of the nodes whose ids are in the input set argument, excluding the nodes in the input argument set.
      int Graph.getNodeIdByLabel(java.lang.Object label)
      return the id of the node whose label is passed in the argument label (if it exists, otherwise throw GraphException)

    • Uses of GraphException in graph.coarsening

      Methods in graph.coarsening that throw GraphException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void Coarsener.coarsen() 
      void CoarsenerIEC.coarsen()
      coarsen() performs the following loop until the number of unmatched nodes is less than a ratio of the orinigal nodes: we visit an unvisited node randomly; we match it with the neighbor that yields the maximum value of arcs connecting weight * lamda + (1-lamda)*sum_of_weights_of_arcs_conn_common_nbors we mark as visited both nodes that were matched of course
      abstract void HCoarsener.coarsen() 
      void HCoarsenerIEC.coarsen()
      coarsen() performs the following loop until the number of unmatched nodes is less than a ratio of the orinigal nodes: we visit an unvisited node randomly; we match it with the neighbor that yields the maximum value of arcs connecting weight * lamda + (1-lamda)*sum_of_weights_of_arcs_conn_common_nbors we mark as visited both nodes that were matched of course

    • Uses of GraphException in utils

      Methods in utils that throw GraphException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Graph DataMgr.readGraphFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
      filename format is of the form: [ numnodes numarcs starta enda [weighta] [...] ] The starta, enda are in [0...num_nodes-1] weighta is double (non-negative)
      static Graph DataMgr.readGraphFromFile2(java.lang.String filename)
      filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes starta enda [weighta] [...] [weight_node1...] ] The starta, enda are in [1...num_nodes] weighta is double (non-negative) node weights after arcs listing, if they exist, are double (non-negative)
      static Graph DataMgr.readGraphFromhMeTiSFile(java.lang.String filename)
      filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes 1 weighta starta enda [...] ] The starta, enda are in [1...num_nodes] weighta is int (non-negative)
      static Graph DataMgr.readGraphFromhMeTiSFile(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String labelfile)
      same as above method, only that the labelfile serves to read the labels for each of the nodes in the Graph being created
      static HGraph DataMgr.readHGraphFromhMeTiSFile(java.lang.String filename)
      filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes [1] [weighta] node1 node2 ...
